document.docAuthor: Cruz Da Silva, Estevam L. & Carico, James E.

bibRefCitation.author: Mello-Leitao, C. F. de
bibRefCitation.refString: Mello-Leitao, C. F. de. (1948) Contribuicao ao conhecimento da fauna araneologica das Guianas. Anais da Academia Brasileira de Ciencias, 20, 151 - 196.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Thaumasia abrahami
Mello-Leitão, 1948: 152
, fig. 1, female holotype from Yawakuri river , Upper Demerara-Berbice Guyana [ 05°18’N , 58°22’W ],
July 1919
, A. A. Abraham leg ., deposited in BMNH (examined).

subSubSection.paragraph: Note. The match between males and females was made after the examination of the female holotype , since many males and females were found together in the same vial in some Brazilian collections.

Diagnosis. The females of
T. abrahami
resemble those of
T. onca
sp. nov.
( Fig. 107 ) and
T. hirsutochela
sp. nov.
( Fig. 107 ) in the general shape of the middle field ( Fig. 80 ), but can be distinguished by “hood-like” shape of the middle field ( Fig. 80 ), by the conspicuous hood ( Fig. 80 ) and by the shape and the projected pores on the head of spermathecae ( Figs 81, 82 ). The males resemble those of
T. caxiuana
sp. nov.
in the shape of the apex of the median apophysis ( Fig. 89 ), but can be distinguished by the slightly longer median apophysis ( Fig. 84 ) and by the longer and triangular shape of the ectal branch of RTA ( Figs 85–87 ).
